qas.question: Where was the first movie projected for a paying audience in Paris?
What date was the first movie played in Paris for a paying crowd?
In what decade did movie theaters become popular?
What is the largest cinema room today in Paris?

context:
The movie industry was born in Paris when Auguste and Louis Lumière projected the first motion picture for a paying audience at the <a0_0>Grand Café<a0_0/> on <a1_0>28 December 1895<a1_0/>. Many of Paris' concert/dance halls were transformed into movie theatres when the media became popular beginning in the <a2_0>1930s<a2_0/>. Later, most of the largest cinemas were divided into multiple, smaller rooms. Paris' largest cinema room today is in <a3_0>Le Grand Rex<a3_0/> theatre with 2,700 seats.
Big multiplex movie theaters have been built since the 1990s. UGC Ciné Cité Les Halles with 27 screens, MK2 Bibliothèque with 20 screens and UGC Ciné Cité Bercy with 18 screens are among the largest.
